title: Gasing Guardian
description: Built a physics-based grappling hook, player combat system, and enemy AI for a 3D platformer.

detailedInfo.overview: Gasing Guardian is a 2D physics-based platformer created in Unity. The game blends traditional Malaysian culture with fast-paced, modern gameplay. Players control a hero armed with a 'gasing' (a traditional top) which functions as a versatile grappling hook, combat weapon, and puzzle-solving tool.
detailedInfo.contributions:
As the Project Manager, I led a team of 5, organizing sprints, managing tasks via Trello, and ensuring we met all our milestones.

As the lead Gameplay Programmer, my primary responsibilities included:

  • Physics-Based Grappling Hook: Engineered the core gasing mechanic from scratch.
  • Player Combat System: Developed the state machine for player combat.
  • Enemy AI: Programmed the basic AI for ground-based enemies.

title: Super Nasi Odyssey
description: Developed an 8-way character movement and a timeline-based cutscene system in Unreal Engine for a 2.5D adventure platformer.

detailedInfo.overview:
Aish learns a hard lesson about wasting food when she's cursed by a mysterious wizard! Now trapped in a 2D pixel-art form, she must leap across strange and dangerous multiverses to collect enough food to break the curse.

Super Nasi Odyssey is a fast-paced 2.5D precision platformer where every second counts. Test your reflexes, solve environmental puzzles, and master Aish's abilities to navigate two challenging levels.
detailedInfo.contributions:
As the Project Manager and Gameplay Programmer, I led a team of 4 to deliver this technical showcase.

  • Advanced Movement: Developed a responsive 8-way character movement system.
  • Cutscene System: Implemented a timeline-based cutscene system for narrative delivery.
  • Visual Effects: Created particle systems including running VFX to enhance game feel.
  • Technical Implementation: Utilized the PaperZD plugin to integrate 2D sprite-based animation systems within a 3D Unreal Engine world.

title: Seru Hooty
description: Programmed all core physics and timing-based puzzle mechanics for a 3D puzzle game using Unity.

detailedInfo.overview: Seru Hooty is a 3D puzzle game that challenges player precision and patience. The core gameplay loop revolves around movement timing; players must navigate the environment wisely and smoothly to avoid obstacles in a rhythm-like fashion.
detailedInfo.contributions:
I was responsible for the entire codebase for this project and also designed the 2nd level.

  • Core Logic: Programmed every aspect of the game from scratch in C#.
  • Physics & Timing: Implemented the core movement timing mechanics and collision detection.
  • UI Implementation: Integrated Aseprite assets into Unity for the user interface.

title: Elian's Bloom
description: Coded all game logic and implemented visual special effects for a 2D game in Pygame.

detailedInfo.overview:
Elian's Bloom is a 2D narrative platformer developed in Python. The story follows Elian, a young boy on an urgent quest to find the 'Golden Bloom' to cure his mother's mysterious 'Wither' sickness.

The journey takes Elian from the corrupted 'Green Tangle' to the magical 'Golden Grove'. Gameplay relies on core platforming mechanics like running, jumping, dashing, and wall-jumping to overcome environmental obstacles and enemies.
detailedInfo.contributions:
As the Lead Programmer and Level Designer, my focus was on building a robust engine using Pygame.

  • Core Engine: Coded the majority of the game logic, including physics and collision, using Python 3.11 and Pygame CE.
  • Visual Effects: Implemented dynamic special effects to visualize the 'Wither' sickness and magical elements.
  • Level Editor: Built and utilized a custom level editor to design the game's two distinct environments.

title: Dungeon Escape (Board Game)
description: Designed and balanced a 3-4 player survival horror board game with PvE/PvP mechanics.

detailedInfo.overview:
Dungeon Escape is a competitive, turn-based survival horror board game for 3-4 players. Players must navigate a dangerous 25x25 grid maze, roll dice to move, and race to find one of two hidden keys to escape.

The twist? A minotaur hunts the players down, advancing after every turn. Players must balance speed and risk, deciding whether to sabotage their friends or focus on their own survival while avoiding traps and the ever-encroaching beast.
detailedInfo.contributions:
My primary contributions were in game design and quality assurance.

  • Game Design & Balancing: Designed the card content and wrote the comprehensive rulesheet to ensure clarity and fairness.
  • QA Testing: Conducted playtests to balance the PvE and PvP mechanics, ensuring the 'Minotaur' threat felt fair but formidable.
  • Visuals: Assisted with asset creation using Photoshop and Canva.

title: Midnight Arcade Mayhem (VR)
description: Programmed the core enemy AI (sleepwalking mum) and designed the house level layout for a comedic VR horror-arcade game.

detailedInfo.overview:
Midnight Arcade Mayhem plunges you into the shoes of a young boy on a mission to play all four hidden arcade minigames before 6 AM—without waking up your sleepwalking mother.

Built for the Meta Quest 2, this VR experience blends stealth, arcade, and horror genres. You must use environmental awareness to tip-toe through hallways, duck behind furniture, and evade the terrifying gaze of Mom.
detailedInfo.contributions:
I focused on the level design and enemy AI implementation for VR.

  • Level Design: Designed the house layout using low-poly models optimized for VR performance on the Quest 2.
  • AI Programming: Implemented the 'Sleepwalking Mum' AI using Unity's NavMesh system with random patrol paths.
  • VR Integration: Ensured smooth locomotion and interaction mechanics within the VR environment.

title: Page of Peril
description: Managed a team of 5, designed all puzzles, and wrote the game narrative based on a 2D-to-3D world-switching mechanic.

detailedInfo.overview:
Page of Peril is a narrative-driven puzzle-platformer set within a child’s notebook. You play as 'Sketch', a stickman entity who gains sentience and tries to escape the drawing world.

The core mechanic involves a dimension-shifting ability. Players can toggle between a 2D Orthographic view and a 3D Perspective view to reveal hidden paths, bypass 'impassable' 2D obstacles, and manage their 'Ink' stamina.
detailedInfo.contributions:
I served as the Project Manager and Lead Designer.

  • Project Management: Managed a team of 5 over 12 weeks to deliver the project using Unity 6.
  • Puzzle Design: Designed the environmental puzzles that require switching between 2D and 3D perspectives.
  • Narrative Writing: Wrote the game narrative centered around Sketch's fight for freedom.
